name: General Data Protection Regulation
overview: General Data Protection Regulation - EU's comprehensive data protection law. Applies to all companies processing EU residents' data, including UK via UK GDPR post-Brexit.

Data_Protection.description: Core data protection principles and requirements

Article 5.description: Principles relating to processing of personal data - Lawfulness, fairness, transparency, purpose limitation, data minimization, accuracy, storage limitation, integrity and confidentiality
Article 5.examples: Data processing impact assessments, Consent management, Privacy by design

Article 25.description: Data protection by design and by default - Implement appropriate technical and organizational measures
Article 25.examples: Privacy-preserving analytics, Secure data processing, Data minimization
Article 25.use_cases: Microsoft Azure Confidential Computing, Vaultree, Enveil

Article 32.description: Security of processing - Implement appropriate technical and organizational measures
Article 32.examples: Data breach prevention, Encryption at rest and in transit, Access controls
Article 32.use_cases: Microsoft Defender for Cloud, CrowdStrike, SentinelOne

Article 33.description: Notification of a personal data breach to the supervisory authority - 72-hour notification requirement
Article 33.examples: Automated breach detection and notification, Incident response workflows, Regulatory reporting
Article 33.use_cases: OneTrust Incident Response, ServiceNow Security Operations, IBM Resilient

Article 35.description: Data protection impact assessment - Required for high-risk processing activities
Article 35.examples: Risk assessment for new processing activities, Compliance documentation, Privacy impact analysis
Article 35.use_cases: OneTrust Privacy Impact Assessment, TrustArc Assessment Manager, Microsoft Purview
